headline: Chocolate Cookies
description: Chocolate cookies made with crunchy chopped walnuts are ready in just 10 minutes and always turn out soft and chewy, just like fudge brownies.
name: Chocolate Cookies

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Cream sugar and margarine in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs, one at a time, then stir in vanilla.

Combine flour, cocoa, baking soda, and salt in a separate bowl. Add to the creamed mixture and mix until just blended. Stir in walnuts. Drop spoonfuls of dough 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven until edges are set and centers are soft, 8 to 10 minutes. Let sit briefly before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.

review.reviewBody: Literally amazing. Made these for my family and they LOVED them. They were just so soft on the inside and crispy/crummy on the outside, loved these so much and would totally use this recipe again!!! I also added white chocolate chips and butterscotch chips in them.🤌
This recipe really needs to be taken down. Does not work. Has to be modified to work.
It had more of a cakey texture it would be much better as a muffin and it tasted like a brownie definitely recommend it!!!
Wow best cookie ever

Excellent cookie! I've made these twice this week. Once, for a gathering and once just for our house. I used unsalted butter and left out the nuts. Baked on a dark non stick cookie sheet with a silicone mat, these took just at 9 minutes. On my larger stainless sheet with parchment paper, it took 10. The cookies had crisp chewy edges and tender centers. These had the rich chocolatey flavor of a brownie. Both times they spread out quite a bit and turned out pretty flat. I even chilled the dough to see if it made difference the second time. It did not. Chilling the dough made it difficult to scoop, and it didn't prevent total spread of the dough. This is a keeper. This gave me 5 dozen delicious cookies to share.
so good
Smellavision...I used mint extract...home is full of fresh cookies...edges came out crisp, middle is soft...just like brownies. Love it.
Absolutely loved! I used an ice cream scoop to make the cookie size and instead of using walnuts I used pecans. Will definitely be making again, great recipe!

Simple and easy,delicious. As a side note, and let me qualify myself first. I'm a professional restaurant chef of 30 ÷ years experience. As with most all cookie recipes you must refrigerate the dough for at least an hour before using to stabilize the margarine in the dough or it Will spread out in the oven as it cooks. Give this recipe a fair shake and you will be rewarded with one VERY good cookie. :) enjoy!
Loved this recipe. Easy to make and tastes great. One of the best recipes I have tried in a while.
Omg, just made these... I've eaten 3 already! Very soft and chewy and richly chocolate. Exactly what I wanted.
I added peanut butter chips to this recipe. They didn't last more than 24 hours bc my family ate them all. So, so good!!

Absolutely delicious!! I promised my 2 1/2 year old grandson I would make him chocolate cookies and these were definately the ones he will remember!!! Hubby love's them too definately a keeper recipie because I know everyone will want them often! Perfection
They came out great! Easy and delicious recipe
I made these and they are GREAT! DELICIOUS!

Made 12/22. Used butter not margarine. Cut ingredients in half which made 32 cookies. Used ungreased nonstick cookie sheets and cookies did not stick to pan after baking. these cookies do want to spread out so i rolled them into tight balls which i think reduced their spread. Bake time was 9 minutes. The result was a very good chocolatey cookie. Will make again.

I made this account just to make this review. At first I made two sheets with the recipe made to the t with differing sizes, and they were absolutely horrible. They were extremely runny and not evenly baked. I experimented with adding more flour and a pinch of baking powder, and they ended up somewhat okay. I’d highly recommend going with another recipe for this.

These do actually taste like brownies. Please don't use margarine while baking cookies. Margarine should not exist in this universe, gross. I used butter and some random cacao powder from Costco. Added some Hershey Kisses after pulling out of the oven. Only cooked for 8.5 minutes.
Followed closely and they turned out great. Tq

My 3-year old daughter and I made these on a whim, and they came out Perfect👌🏾. We didn't have enough granulated sugar, so we used 100% pure cane sugar and they taste "mwuah!- chef's kiss". I saved this one to make again for when I get a sweet tooth or hankering for chocolate lol
Yes the only thing changed was that I use a small cookie scoop, when I put the cookies onto a cookie sheet.

The turned out AMAZING, exactly how I wanted. However, it did make exactly 50 cookie TwT. On the bright side, this is my first time successfully making cookies without them turning into basically pancakes lol(please don't judge for that, im only a teen and just got into baking a few months ago)
I used this recipe and added mini chocolate chips and mint chunks and they were the absolute best cookies I've ever made or had. Will definitely be making again!
Made 27 with how big I made them! Turned out great, used white chocolate chips instead of walnuts
I made this for Thanksgiving and they turned out great, both with and without walnuts!

Sooo good! I used butter instead of margarine. Everyone loved them and asked if I had used brownie batter in them. So good that I created an allrecipe account just to leave this review! I don't know what people did wrong in the bad reviews. Obviously their error. I'm not much of a baker and had no issues.

These where so bad do not do this they turned into literal burnt piles of mush and I followed the recipe perfectly I don't know what went wrong but they're so thin they crumble when I try to pick them up. DO NOT TRY THIS
My husband loved these cookies and I agree. So simple and delicious. I actually prefer these to brownies. Crisp and chewy. I'm going to try this recipe with peanut butter chips next time.
Oh my god, this recipe would be absolutely perfect for my maid/cat cafe! This recipe is amazing!
amazing 🤩 - jhye
Made half batch w coconut sugar/white sugar, butter, delish. Thanks for the inspiration.

Perfect Cookie! I used butter instead of margarine and instead of walnuts added 1 cup of white chocolate chips and 1/2 cup of milk chocolate chips. I melted a bit of the butter and mixed the cocoa powder In with it then added it back to the creamed butter and sugar to cut the powdery taste many chocolate cookies have. Made the perfect cookie that was gooey in the middle and crispy around the edges

So yummy..tweeked it a tad...made dough and put it in the fridge to set while I made dinner, made 2inch balls on a sprayed sheet, baked for 12min and 30 sec @350...didn't have walnuts and used almonds (next time I want to sub pecans!) Very yummy...recommend in a small cookie form...also can place pretty close together if u chill
Family loved it
The cookies came out fantastic. I used butter instead of margarine. I'll definitely use this recipe again
I opted for the new nut version and these are delicious!

The poor reviews scared me. I almost didn't follow this but they couldn't be farther from the truth. I'm so glad I made these! If you actually know how to and do in fact follow the recipe these come out perfectly not flat delicious and moist. Excellent recipe. Don't let those who can't follow instructions put you off you won't be disappointed!

This recipe is fantastic. My whole family loves these cookies. We call them chocolate brownie cookies. I agree with everyone that the dough is sticky but what helped me achieve a perfect round color is that I used a tea spoon full and I took the dough in my Gand and rolled it into hall and placed it on the baking sheet ajd baked them that way since thw reviews said they spread out a lot. Rolling the dough into a ball made them spread out evenly and perfect while baking. Added my photo to this review.

This recipe was great . It was easy and minimal, I loved it but tweeted it a bit. I added 1 quarter tsp baking powder, half tsp nutmeg and 1and a half cups sugar instead of 2. It came out very nice. Thank you

I followed this recipe to a T. Double checked oven temp after the first runny batch. This is the worst recipe for chocolate cookies I've ever tried! Flat, runny mess! DO NOT USE THIS RECIPE. Thanks for wasting my supplies and time!
It's very good and very precised receipt and have a well tasted results

for anyone reading this, these arent cookies... i had a problem of them sticking to the pan, they spread thin as paper across the baking sheet, so i baked them in cupcake liners, and made brownie cups, turned out perfectly. theyre brownies
They baked up perfect for me. Love them. Great job. Thank you

Yes increase your flour a little at a time until it resembles your typical texture of store bought cookie dough. Also I only used half the ingredients for a smaller batch. And reduced the butter to 1/2 cup+1/4 cup powdered sugar added to the granulated sugar.
These cookies were not too sweet and are the perfect balance of gooey middle crunchy edges (our family favorite).
Easy to make and taste great

My cookies turned out great and they taste delicious. I follow the recipe exactly. I also read the reviews so I used a small spoon to scoop the dough out of my mixing bowl. It’s a sticky dough. I lightly rolled my dough into a ball and baked it like that since reviews said the dough speads
This recipe was so easy and it made perfect little brownie tasting cookies perfectly round and mine were fluffy round not thin at all. Best recipe for chocolate cookies and will be making again.

These are quick and satisfy a chewy chocolate craving. I’m used to a thicker batter for cookies so I was nervous when the batter was a bit thin. I did chill it for about 20 minutes. They taste like brownies. I’m tempted to pour the batter into a brownie pan. I can’t imagine what has gone wrong with some other people’s attempts that they hate this recipe. I think it’s fun and my family loved them.
I halved the recipe, and I came out with about 16 cookies. Amazing, not too sweet and super easy to make!

I cut down from 2 cups to 1-1/4 cups of sugar because I don't like overly sweet cookies. Also, can't do tree nuts, so left out the walnuts. Other than that, this was a great quick and easy chocolate cookie recipe. Mine came out perfectly moist and fudgy! Don't understand the complaints about this recipe other than they didn't measure the ingredients properly? This recipe is a keeper for me.
My absolute favourite recipe! The changes I made was to use butter and not margarine, and chill it in the freezer before baking.
They were delicious 😋
Easy to make. I used 1 tsp drop and got 4.5 dozen. Big hit with the family. Will make these more often.
I think this recipe is the best. I would add a little bit less cocoa but other than that everyone in my family loved it. I will do it again for sure.

The only good reviews, are the altered reviews. As written this recipe is not good at all. Used my smallest cookie scoop and had four long cookies. Then did a sheet using a tea spoon. They did not run together, but are small thin wafers. The other half of the batter (not dough) I just put in a lightly greased pie pan. Now I have the worlds thinnest brownie. I wish people could just rate the recipes as written. As a matter of fact I wish Allrecipes would remove the altered recipe reviews.
Didn't add much walnuts as my boy doesn't eat nuts but they were delicious thank you.
I worry about ya'll sometimes. I swapped the margarine for a stick of butter and used chocolate chips instead of nuts and they turned out awesome.

I was looking for a chocolate cookie recipe that was not death by chocolate. I came across this one and tried it. It was very good. The Doe came together quickly, I added a teaspoon of espresso powder. I baked as directed and they came out perfect. they are soft and gooey in the inside and slightly crispy on the outside

The easiest, best chocolate cookie recipe you will ever find… took me less than 30 minutes to get the first batch in, and came out great. Has a rich taste, yet not too rich. As well as a chewy consistency. Family loved it, I will definitely write this one down in my recipe book, and suggest it to anyone looking for a great chocolate cookie recipe.
Awful. There’s way too much butter! Even when all of the dry ingredients were mixed it, the “dough” was incredibly sticky and couldn’t hold its shape at all. It was like brownie batter.
Best chocolate cookies ever!!!

I thought they were delicious. I made sure to refrigerate my dough...most cookie recipes I do this. I also put some spray on my pans and there wasn't an issue with sticking. They are thin but they taste just like the side of the brownie...best part!

I followed the recipe and got really nice tall cookies. Bit crunchy because i used butter that wasn't soft enough. I used big balls of dough with about 12 of them on 1 tray. the cookies merged but were quite tall. try big balls with no chilling and 20-225 min in oven at the same temp.
The recipe was great! I substituted butter flavor crisco and added Nestle Toll House peppermint hot cocoa morsels & more. Very good!!
These were terrible. I made them in my junior high home economics class. I would not recommend them! Only 1 group actually had what I would consider to be a decent cookie.

This is great when you want a very quick easy to make chocolate snack. They are great for those making medicinal cookies as they are easy, fast , and frankly hard to mess up. They will never win awards but aren't intended to. I think of them as a fast easy mother's little helper.
Came out pretty good. I substituted nuts for white chocolate chips. My choir class is gonna love it!
Yummy!! Perfect recipe ??
I loved these cookies, I used butter not margarine and eliminated the walnuts. Nice tasty and chewy.
Not chewy at all. They are more like cake. Not a fan
No issues, worked well. Cookies were nice.

These cookies are great! I was craving chocolate cookies but had no chocolate chips. Found this recipe and gave it a try. 

I'm really not sure why there are so many negative reviews or people saying the recipe doesn't work. If you give them space on the cookie sheet (don't put them super close because they do flatten) then there is no issue with them turning into one giant cookie like some people have commented. 

I did leave them in the oven a bit longer and let them cool on the tray for 3-4 min before moving to a cooling rack. That stopped them falling apart. 

I also subbed out margarine for butter and it worked great. 

Every issue I've seen in the comments relates to common sense when baking.
Made it with butter and they are chocolate heaven

I love this recipe and had great luck with my cookies. I used very fine flour and chilled the dough between batches. I turned them into pumpkin spice cookies and they are perfect to celebrate the first day of fall with.
It’s was great! I did everything instruction. I did not add walnuts though. They turned out like a dark golden brown. They tasted great.
Super yummy! I didn't add the walnuts but they're fantastic without them. I definitely recommend chilling for at least an hour before putting into oven though, it was about as thin as warm margarine

Taste like brownies!
This is a go to recipe for me now

This recipe is horrible. I tried making these cookies as a treat and all the cookies combine together into one big giant blob and then smells burnt. I then had to cut it and try to pick it up but it completely breaks in my hands. It even looked like the moon when I took it out of the oven. I used the rest of the batter was used to make a nice cake since it was cake batter more then cookie batter. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS RECIPE!!!
Loved, loved, loved this recipe. I used pecans instead of walnuts but otherwise followed it exactly & it was cookie perfection!
I followed the recipe but the cookies did not spread. They stayed in balls. Very odd.

Delicious and pretty! I’m not sure what all the complaints are about, because these came out perfectly for me. I did chill the dough for about 30 mins first, as I do with most cookies, and I left the walnuts out since the fam doesn’t like them. A little spray of Pam on the cookie sheet kept them from sticking. My teenagers and boyfriend devoured them. One review said theirs were flat and oddly shaped, and that they wouldn’t take them to a bbq or event. I did not find this to be the case for me at all, as mine came out round and soft. I will definitely make these again!

In love with this recipe. Instead of margarine I used butter, added 1 cup of chocolate chips and sprinkled the walnuts on top before baking. I also used an ice cream scoop (3T portion scoop)to portion out my cookies since I live a big cookie. They came out perfectly.

Waaaay too much baking soda in this recipe. Cookies puffed up in the oven then fell flat. Otherwise a good recipe, still slightly chewy despite paper thin result. Obviously I'll alter next time and I'm sure they'll be perfect.

i made these and let me tell you... great flavor but the cookies thinned so badly after i took them out of the oven and they broke apart when i tried to put them from the cookie pan onto a cooking rack. wouldn’t make these again.
Love this recipe! I like adding chocolate chips instead of walnuts and it's so good! it's a quick recipe to make before guests come over and is always a hit with the family.
My family decided these are their favorite cookies ever! Really does taste like brownies. i'm going to try adding Reese's Pieces.

Hi! I made this recipe today and is an OK one at best, its nothing amazing or mindblowing but simple and fun to eat. If you want to make a recipe with someone young, this would be the one to make! (be careful of how long you cook it for, I had to do mine for a bit longer than 10 minutes)

Use softened butter instead of margarine, one cup white sugar and one cup brown sugar instead of 2 cups white sugar, top with chocolate chunks/chips instead of walnuts, and instead of freezing it you can directly put it into a pan after rolling it into balls and trust me it tastes so good and soft and makes the most roundest cookies ever!! Look at the pic

Okay so my thoughts: add a couple tsp. of milk to your batter 2-4 tsp. Will do just the trick well it did for me... then spray your non stick pan cook @325° for the time recommended I did 10 min... it tasted just like brownie cookies! And they're chewy in the center not doughy but like a perfect little brownie! I'm making these more often rather than chocolate chip from now on! Also I made half the recipe hope this helps.
This recipe is like eating a small brownie in each bite. Very, very good cookies. Everybody loves this cookie when I take it somewhere. 5 stars
I never bake. I did half batch, they turned out perfect. I used salted butter and baked on air baking pan. I didn't use nuts but will at some point.

Followed the recipe step by step but the cookies turned out flat, chewy that sticks to you’re teeth and not the taste you would want for a cookie.
Would not recommend
These are the best cookies I have ever had they are so delicious great recipe you should definitely make them they are amazing.
stuff be bussin fr yum yum in me tum tum so good

I made a half batch. These cookies were fantastic. I followed the recipe with no changes. I bake all cookies on parchment paper. Waited 2 minutes after baking before removing to a cooling rack. Great chocolate flavor!

I’m surprised by some of the bad reviews. This is my go to cookie recipe. I’ve made it as written and I’ve used it as a base to make up other types of cookies! It’s so easy and it always turns out for me. Great flavour! I’m not sure why it says “softened” margarine. You obviously don’t need to soften margarine...it’s always soft. Maybe that’s why people have trouble with thin batter
Not a good recipe at all it didn’t even look like cookie dough it looked like cake batter it was so liquidy I don’t recommend this website for other recipes either
This is probably my #1 favorite cookie recipe. I have made it so many times this year!
